summary: "The Three Musketeers" is a thrilling adventure story by French author Alexandre Dumas. Written in 1844, it's the first in a series about a young man, d'Artagnan, who leaves home for Paris, dreaming of joining the elite Musketeers. Though he doesn't join right away, he befriends three top musketeers: Athos, Porthos, and Aramis. Together, they embark on exciting adventures, getting involved in politics and royal affairs. The book also criticizes the unfairness of the old French government, making it important at the time it was written. The story continues in "Twenty Years After" and "The Vicomte of Bragelonne."
title: The Three Musketeers
